title: Number Systems
description: Basic concepts of number systems, integers, fractions, and decimals

formulas.title: GCD (Greatest Common Divisor)
formulas.formula: GCD(a, b) = largest number that divides both a and b without a remainder

formulas.title: Prime Factorization
formulas.formula: Express a number as a product of its prime factors

basic.question: Find the GCD of 24 and 36
basic.explanation: The GCD of 24 and 36 is 12 because 12 is the largest number that divides both 24 and 36 without a remainder.

advanced.question: If the LCM of two numbers is 84 and their GCD is 6, find one pair of numbers that satisfy these conditions.
advanced.explanation: The product of two numbers = LCM × GCD = 84 × 6 = 504. The pair 12 and 42 works because 12 × 42 = 504, and GCD(12, 42) = 6, LCM(12, 42) = 84.

advanced.question: Find the smallest positive integer that when divided by 12, 15, and 20 leaves remainders 5, 8, and 13 respectively.
advanced.explanation: The LCM of 12, 15, and 20 is 60. The number is of the form 60k + r where r is the remainder. Checking each option, 293 is the answer as 293 = 60 × 4 + 53, and when divided by 12, 15, and 20, leaves remainders 5, 8, and 13.

test.question: Find the GCD of 54, 90, and 120.
test.explanation: GCD(54, 90, 120) = 6 as 6 is the largest number that divides all three numbers without a remainder.

test.question: Calculate the LCM of 18, 24, and 30.
test.explanation: LCM(18, 24, 30) = 120 as 120 is the smallest number that is divisible by all three numbers.
